title: Acme Chophouse's Duck Confit & Chicory Salad
summary: Need a gluten free and dairy free main course? Acme Chophouse's Duck Confit & Chicory Salad could be an outstanding recipe to try. One serving contains 881 calories, 47g of protein, and 74g of fat. This recipe serves 2 and costs $2.76 per serving. Head to the store and pick up legs of acme chophouse's duck confit, salt and pepper, dijon mustard, and a few other things to make it today. To use up the champagne vinegar you could follow this main course with the Champagne Jello Parfaits â€“ Low Calorie as a dessert. 1 person were glad they tried this recipe. It is an affordable recipe for fans of Mediterranean food. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes approximately 10 minutes. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 48%. This score is good. Similar recipes include Duck Confit Pasta Salad, Blood Orange and Duck Confit Salad, and Duck Confit Salad with Cranberry Vinaigrette.

winePairing.pairingText: Bordeaux, Champagne, and White Burgundy are my top picks for French. French wine is just as diverse as French food, but you rarely go wrong with champagne. If your meal calls for a white wine, you might also try a white burgundy. For a red, try a red bordeaux blend. One wine you could try is Chateau Mauperey Cotes de Bordeaux. It has 4.6 out of 5 stars and a bottle costs about 18 dollars.
